title: Testing automated quarto rendering
text:
The action will render Quarto documents contained in the directory by taking these steps:

Downloading and installing the latest Quarto CLI release from quarto-dev/quarto-cli
Set up Python via actions/setup-python
Install all Python requirements from requirements.txt (parsing for platform specific packages)
Set up R via r-lib/actions/setup-r
Restore the R environment from the renv lockfile
Calls quarto render at the root of the github repository.
Pushes and commits any changes to the docs folder.
NOTE: You will likely need to git pull this repo after running the quarto-render workflow as there are likely to be changes made afterwards.

title: Jupyter Notebook Demo
text:
Helper functions:

def reverse_complement(nuc_sequence: str) -> str:
    """
    Returns the reverse complement of a nucleotide sequence.
    >>> reverse_complement('ACGT')
    'ACGT'
    >>> reverse_complement('ATCGTGCTGCTGTCGTCAAGAC')
    'GTCTTGACGACAGCAGCACGAT'
    >>> reverse_complement('TGCTAGCATCGAGTCGATCGATATATTTAGCATCAGCATT')
    'AATGCTGATGCTAAATATATCGATCGACTCGATGCTAGCA'
     """
    complements = {
        'A': 'T',
        'C': 'G',
        'G': 'C',
        'T': 'A',
        '[': ']',
        ']': '[',
    }
    rev_seq = ''.join([complements[s] for s in nuc_sequence[::-1]])
    return rev_seq

def random_dna_seq(seq_length):
    """Generates a random DNA sequence of length seq_length"""
    from random import choice
    return ''.join(choice('ACTG') for _ in range(seq_length))


dna_seqs = [random_dna_seq(20) for _ in range(10)]


for i, dna_seq in enumerate(dna_seqs):
    print(f'The reverse complement of dna seq. {i} is {reverse_complement(dna_seq)}.')

The reverse complement of dna seq. 0 is TGGCCACCAAGCCGTTCCAT.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 1 is TCTAGGTCTCATCTGTGTAC.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 2 is CCCCATCTGCATTTAAGATG.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 3 is TCCGATGGTCCCTTTAATTA.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 4 is ACAATTAGTGCAGTCCGGTA.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 5 is CCACAAGGCGGCTCTGTACT.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 6 is CGAGCTACTTCTCGATGCCT.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 7 is ATTACAAATGCCACCCGCCG.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 8 is GGGCCGTTTAACCCGGTGGG.
The reverse complement of dna seq. 9 is GAATTGTTCGCAACATAAGA.

title: Python and R Demo
Python and R Demo
text:
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) +
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = FALSE)

title: Python demo
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see fig. 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()





Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: R Example
text:
Testing man.


Code
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) +
        geom_point() +
        geom_smooth(method = "loess", se = FALSE)
